Class Sound

  • java.lang.Object
    • Sound

  • public class Sound
extends java.lang.Object
    This class deals with playing, stopping, and looping of background music for the game.
    See Also:
    free music - https://www.bensound.com/royalty-free-music/cinematic

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Sound(java.lang.String fileName)
      This is the constructor method of this class, it asks for a .wav file and then creates a clip which will be played in a loop.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      it arrests the clip
      void play()
      it allows to play the clip
      void stop()
      it pauses the clip

    • Constructor Detail

      • Sound

        public Sound(java.lang.String fileName)
        This is the constructor method of this class, it asks for a .wav file and then creates a clip which will be played in a loop. It throws some debugging messages in case the operation does not run as expected
        Parameters:
        fileName - this is the name of the file that will be played. It has to be a .wav file
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if file is not found
        java.net.MalformedURLException - if the URL is malformed
        javax.sound.sampled.UnsupportedAudioFileException - if the file is not supported
        java.io.IOException - if an input or output exception occurs
        javax.sound.sampled.LineUnavailableException - if line cannot be opened because it is unavailable
        See Also:
        https://stackoverflow.com/questions/11919009/using-javax-sound-sampled-clip-to-play-loop-and-stop-multiple-sounds-in-a-game
